Start: ^Eileene… you’ve been quiet ever since we left headquarters. Did something happen?
^Quiet doesn’t mean something’s wrong, Nadine. It just means I’m thinking.
^Funny. Really. I wish humor fixed problems as easily as you pretend it does.
^Hey, I’m being serious. You look… tense. More than usual.
^If you must know, I found something odd in the case files this morning.
^A missing report. Page seventeen. Gone. Completely erased from the archives.
OfficeTalk: ^So what—someone just walked in and removed it? Without triggering any alerts?
^I think someone wants this case buried.
^Well, I hope they realize you’re terrible at letting things go.
^(soft sigh) Nadine… this isn’t a joke.
^I know. That’s why I’m here. Now tell me—what was on page seventeen?
^…A witness name. Someone who claimed to see the incident from across the street.
^Both the witness and the report. Convenient, isn’t it?
Reveal: ^Which means we investigate this ourselves. Quietly.
^Then you’ll have to teach me. Starting now.
^(smiles faintly) Fine. Lesson one: stop making everything a dramatic line.
